00120 typedef unsigned long xnarch_cpumask_t;
00121 #define xnarch_num_online_cpus()         XNARCH_NR_CPUS
00122 #define xnarch_cpu_online_map            ((1<<xnarch_num_online_cpus()) - 1)
00123 #define xnarch_cpu_set(cpu, mask)        ((mask) |= 1 << (cpu))
00124 #define xnarch_cpu_clear(cpu, mask)      ((mask) &= 1 << (cpu))
00125 #define xnarch_cpus_clear(mask)          ((mask) = 0UL)
00126 #define xnarch_cpu_isset(cpu, mask)      (!!((mask) & (1 << (cpu))))
00127 #define xnarch_cpus_and(dst, src1, src2) ((dst) = (src1) & (src2))
00128 #define xnarch_cpus_equal(mask1, mask2)  ((mask1) == (mask2))
00129 #define xnarch_cpus_empty(mask)          ((mask) == 0UL)
00130 #define xnarch_cpumask_of_cpu(cpu)       (1 << (cpu))
00131 #define xnarch_first_cpu(mask)           (ffnz(mask))
00132 #define XNARCH_CPU_MASK_ALL              (~0UL)
00133 
00134 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00135                                                 unsigned long uld,
00136                                                 unsigned long *rem)
00137 {
00138     if (rem)
00139         *rem = ull % uld;
00140 
00141     return ull / uld;
00142 }

00144 static inline unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long word) {
00145     return ffs((int)word) - 1;
00146 }

00151 struct xnthread;

00153 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00154 
00155     const char *name;           /* Symbolic name of thread (can be NULL) */
00156     struct xnthread *thread;    /* VM thread pointer (opaque) */
00157     void *khandle;              /* Kernel handle (opaque) */
00158     void (*entry)(void *);      /* Thread entry */
00159     void *cookie;               /* Thread cookie passed on entry */
00160     int imask;                  /* Initial interrupt mask */
00161     jmp_buf rstenv;             /* Restart context info */
00162     pid_t ppid;
00163     int syncflag;
00164     pthread_t thid;
00165 
00166     /* The following fields are not used by the Fusion skin, however
00167        they are set by the nucleus. */
00168     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00169     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00170 
00171 } xnarchtcb_t;

00183 static inline int __attribute__ ((unused))
00184 xnarch_read_environ (const char *name, const char **ptype, void *pvar)
00185 
00186 {
00187     char *value;
00188 
00189     if (*ptype == NULL)
00190         return 0;       /* Already read in */
00191 
00192     *ptype = NULL;
00193 
00194     value = getenv(name);
00195 
00196     if (!value)
00197         return -1;
00198 
00199     if (**ptype == 's')
00200         *((char **)pvar) = value;
00201     else
00202         *((int *)pvar) = atoi(value);
00203 
00204     return 1;
00205 }
00206 
00207 static int inline xnarch_lock_irq (void) {
00208 
00209     return xnarch_atomic_xchg(&vml_irqlock,1);
00210 }
00211 
00212 static inline void xnarch_unlock_irq (int x) {
00213 
00214     extern int vml_irqpend;
00215 
00216     if (!x && vml_irqlock)
00217         {
00218         if (xnarch_atomic_xchg(&vml_irqpend,0))
00219             __pthread_release_vm(&vml_irqlock);
00220         else
00221             vml_irqlock = 0;
00222         }
00223 }

00237 int vml_irqlock = 0;
00238 
00239 int vml_irqpend = 0;
00240 
00241 void xnarch_sync_irq (void)
00242 
00243 {
00244     if (vml_irqlock)
00245         __pthread_hold_vm(&vml_irqpend);
00246 }
00247 
00248 static inline int xnarch_hook_irq (unsigned irq,
00249                                    void (*handler)(unsigned irq,
00250                                                    void *cookie),
00251                                    void *cookie) {
00252     if (irq == 0)
00253         return -EINVAL; /* Reserved for the timer thread. */
00254 
00255     return -ENOSYS;
00256 }

00301 int vml_done = 0;

00310 static void xnarch_restart_handler (int sig) {
00311 
00312     longjmp(vml_current->rstenv,1);
00313 }
00314 
00315 void xnarch_exit_handler (int sig)
00316 
00317 {
00318     vml_done = 1;
00319     __pthread_activate_vm(vml_root->khandle,vml_current->khandle);
00320     exit(99);
00321 }
00322 
00323 int main (int argc, char *argv[])
00324 
00325 {
00326     struct sigaction sa;
00327     int err;
00328 
00329     if (geteuid() !=0)
00330         {
00331         fprintf(stderr,"This program must be run with root privileges");
00332         exit(1);
00333         }
00334 
00335     err = __xeno_main_init();
00336 
00337     if (err)
00338         {
00339         fprintf(stderr,"main_init() failed, err=%x\n",err);
00340         exit(2);
00341         }
00342 
00343     err = __xeno_skin_init();
00344 
00345     if (err)
00346         {
00347         fprintf(stderr,"skin_init() failed, err=%x\n",err);
00348         exit(3);
00349         }
00350 
00351     err = __xeno_user_init();
00352 
00353     if (err)
00354         {
00355         fprintf(stderr,"user_init() failed, err=%x\n",err);
00356         exit(4);
00357         }
00358 
00359     sa.sa_handler = &xnarch_restart_handler;
00360     sigemptyset(&sa.sa_mask);
00361     sa.sa_flags = SA_RESTART;
00362     sigaction(XNARCH_SIG_RESTART,&sa,NULL);
00363 
00364     sa.sa_handler = &xnarch_exit_handler;
00365     sa.sa_flags = 0;
00366     sigaction(SIGTERM,&sa,NULL);
00367     sigaction(SIGHUP,&sa,NULL);
00368     sigaction(SIGINT,&sa,NULL);
00369 
00370     while (!vml_done)
00371         __pthread_idle_vm(&vml_irqlock);
00372 
00373     __xeno_user_exit();
00374     __xeno_skin_exit();
00375     __xeno_main_exit();
00376 
00377     exit(0);
00378 }
00379 
00380 #endif  /* !XENO_MAIN_MODULE */

00387     /* Empty -- not available */
00388 }

00390 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00391     __pthread_cancel_vm(vml_timer_handle,NULL);
00392 }

00394 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */

00396 #ifdef XENO_POD_MODULE
00397 
00398 extern void *vml_timer_handle;
00399 
00400 xnsysinfo_t vml_info;
00401 
00402 xnarchtcb_t *vml_root;
00403 
00404 xnarchtcb_t *vml_current;
00405 
00406 /* NOTES:
00407 
00408    o IRQ threads have no TCB, since they are not known by the VM
00409    abstraction.
00410 
00411    o All in-kernel IRQ threads serving the VM have the same priority
00412    level, except when they wait on a synchonization barrier.
00413 
00414    o In theory, the IRQ synchronization mechanism might end up
00415    causing interrupt loss, since we might be sleeping to much waiting
00416    on the irqlock barrier until it is signaled. In practice, this
00417    should not happen because interrupt-free sections are short thanks
00418    to the mutex scheme.
00419 */
00420 
00421 struct xnarch_tick_parms {
00422     time_t sec;
00423     long nsec;
00424     void (*tickhandler)(void);
00425     pid_t ppid;
00426     int syncflag;
00427 };
00428 
00429 static void *xnarch_timer_thread (void *cookie)
00430 
00431 {
00432     struct xnarch_tick_parms *p = (struct xnarch_tick_parms *)cookie;
00433     void (*tickhandler)(void) = p->tickhandler;
00434     struct timespec ts;
00435 
00436     pthread_create_rt("vmtimer",NULL,p->ppid,&p->syncflag,&vml_timer_handle);
00437     pthread_migrate_rt(FUSION_RTAI_DOMAIN);
00438 
00439     ts.tv_sec = p->sec;
00440     ts.tv_nsec = p->nsec;
00441 
00442     for (;;)
00443         {
00444         nanosleep(&ts,NULL);
00445         xnarch_sync_irq();
00446         tickhandler(); /* Should end up in xnintr_clock_handler() here. */
00447         }
00448 
00449     return NULL;
00450 }
00451 
00452 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long nstick,
00453                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))
00454 {
00455     struct xnarch_tick_parms parms;
00456     struct sched_param param;
00457     unsigned long tickval;
00458     pthread_attr_t thattr;
00459     pthread_t thid;
00460 
00461     if (nstick == 0)
00462         /* Cannot do aperiodic timing in UVMs */
00463         return -ENODEV;
00464 
00465     pthread_attr_init(&thattr);
00466     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&thattr,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00467     pthread_attr_setschedpolicy(&thattr,SCHED_FIFO);
00468     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 2;
00469     pthread_attr_setschedparam(&thattr,&param);
00470 
00471     if (vml_info.tickval > nstick)
00472         {
00473         fprintf(stderr,"Xenomai/VM: warning: VM tick freq > nucleus tick freq\n");
00474         fprintf(stderr,"          : rounding VM tick to %lu us\n",vml_info.tickval / 1000);
00475         tickval = vml_info.tickval;
00476         }
00477     else
00478         {
00479         tickval = ((nstick + vml_info.tickval - 1) / vml_info.tickval) * vml_info.tickval;
00480 
00481         if (tickval != nstick)
00482             {
00483             fprintf(stderr,"Xenomai/VM: warning: VM tick not a multiple of nucleus tick\n");
00484             fprintf(stderr,"          : rounding VM tick to %lu us\n",tickval / 1000);
00485             }
00486         }
00487 
00488     parms.sec = tickval / 1000000000;
00489     parms.nsec = tickval % 1000000000;
00490     parms.tickhandler = tickhandler;
00491     parms.syncflag = 0;
00492     parms.ppid = getpid();
00493 
00494     pthread_create(&thid,&thattr,&xnarch_timer_thread,&parms);
00495     pthread_sync_rt(&parms.syncflag);
00496     pthread_start_rt(vml_timer_handle);
00497 
00498     return 0;
00499 }
00500 
00501 static inline void xnarch_leave_root(xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00502 }
00503 
00504 static inline void xnarch_enter_root(xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00505 }
00506 
00507 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00508                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb) {
00509     vml_current = in_tcb;
00510     __pthread_activate_vm(in_tcb->khandle,out_tcb->khandle);
00511 }
00512 
00513 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00514                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb) {
00515     vml_current = next_tcb;
00516     __pthread_cancel_vm(dead_tcb->khandle,next_tcb->khandle);
00517 }
00518 
00519 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb) {
00520 
00521     __pthread_cancel_vm(dead_tcb->khandle,NULL);
00522 }

00525     /* Handled by the in-kernel nucleus */
00526 }
00527 
00528 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00529     /* Handled by the in-kernel nucleus */
00530 }
00531 
00532 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00533                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00534                                          const char *name)
00535 {
00536     struct sched_param param;
00537 
00538     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO);
00539 
00540     if (sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param) < 0 ||
00541         pthread_info_rt(&vml_info) < 0)
00542         {
00543         perror("Xenomai/VM");
00544         exit(1);
00545         }
00546 
00547     pthread_init_rt("vmroot",tcb,&tcb->khandle);
00548     pthread_migrate_rt(FUSION_RTAI_DOMAIN);
00549 
00550     tcb->name = name;
00551     vml_root = vml_current = tcb;
00552 }
00553 
00554 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00555 
00556     tcb->khandle = NULL;
00557 }
00558 
00559 static void *xnarch_thread_trampoline (void *cookie)
00560 
00561 {
00562     xnarchtcb_t *tcb = (xnarchtcb_t *)cookie;
00563 
00564     if (!setjmp(tcb->rstenv))
00565         {
00566         /* After this, we are controlled by the in-kernel nucleus. */
00567         pthread_create_rt(tcb->name,tcb,tcb->ppid,&tcb->syncflag,&tcb->khandle);
00568         pthread_migrate_rt(FUSION_RTAI_DOMAIN);
00569         }
00570 
00571     xnarch_setimask(tcb->imask);
00572 
00573     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->thread);
00574 
00575     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00576 
00577     return NULL;
00578 }
00579 
00580 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00581                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00582                                        void *cookie,
00583                                        int imask,
00584                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00585                                        char *name)
00586 {
00587     struct sched_param param;
00588     pthread_attr_t thattr;
00589 
00590     if (tcb->khandle)   /* Restarting thread */
00591         {
00592         pthread_kill(tcb->thid,XNARCH_SIG_RESTART);
00593         return;
00594         }
00595 
00596     tcb->imask = imask;
00597     tcb->entry = entry;
00598     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00599     tcb->thread = thread;
00600     tcb->name = name;
00601     tcb->ppid = getpid();
00602     tcb->syncflag = 0;
00603 
00604     pthread_attr_init(&thattr);
00605     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&thattr,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00606     pthread_attr_setschedpolicy(&thattr,SCHED_FIFO);
00607     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO);
00608     pthread_attr_setschedparam(&thattr,&param);
00609     pthread_create(&tcb->thid,&thattr,&xnarch_thread_trampoline,tcb);
00610 
00611     pthread_sync_rt(&tcb->syncflag);
00612 }
00613 
00614 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00615     /* Handled by the in-kernel nucleus */
00616 }
00617 
00618 int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00619 
00620 {
00621     spl_t s;
00622     splhigh(s);
00623     splexit(!!imask);
00624     return !!s;
00625 }

00641 
00642 void xnarch_sleep_on (int *flagp)
00643 
00644 {
00645     while (!*flagp)
00646         {
00647         struct timespec ts;
00648         ts.tv_sec = 0;
00649         ts.tv_nsec = 10000000;
00650         nanosleep(&ts,NULL);
00651         }
00652 }
00653

00656     void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00657     xnpod_schedule_handler();

00686 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00687     unsigned long long t;
00688     pthread_time_rt(&t);
00689     return t;
00690 }

00693     return xnarch_get_cpu_time();

00700 static inline void xnarch_halt (const char *emsg) {
00701     fprintf(stderr,"Xenomai/VM: fatal: %s\n",emsg);
00702     fflush(stderr);
00703     xnarch_exit_handler(SIGKILL);
00704     exit(99);
00705 }
